options.label: A
options.text: Patients with uncomplicated upper respiratory tract infection, may have mild symptoms such as fever, cough, sore throat, nasal congestion, malaise and headache

options.label: B
options.text: Patients (adults) with presence of clinical features of dypnea and or hypoxia, fever, cough, SPO2 < 94% on room air, RR > 24/minute

options.label: C
options.text: Children with dyspnea, fever, cough, SpO2 < 94% and tachypnea ( < 2months > 60/min, 2-11 months > 50/min and 1-5years > 40/minute)

questions.text: Management of moderate cases of COVID-19 involves all except

options.label: B
options.text: Hydroxychloroquin (400mg) BD on day 1 followed by 200mg BD for 4 days

options.label: C
options.text: Follow CRP,D-Dimer and ferritin every 48-72 hours

questions.text: Is prophylactic enoxaparin indicated in COVID-19 ?

options.label: A
options.text: Yes, it should be given to all cases irrespective of the severity of the disease

options.label: B
options.text: No, it is contra-indicated in COVID-19

options.label: C
options.text: Yes, it should be given in moderate and severe cases

options.label: D
options.text: Warfarin and not enoxaparin should be given to these patients

questions.correct_answer: C. Yes, it should be given in moderate and severe cases

questions.text: When should proning be started in patients with severe ARDS

options.label: A
options.text: When P/F < 300 on FiO2 > 0.6 and PEEP > 6 cm of H2O

options.label: B
options.text: When P/F < 200 on FiO2 > 0.6 and PEEP > 6cm of H2O

options.label: C
options.text: When P/F < 200 and FiO2 > 0.8 and PEEP > 8cm H2O

options.label: D
options.text: When P/F < 150 and FiO2 > 0.6 and PEEP > 5cm H2O

questions.correct_answer: D. When P/F < 150 and FiO2 > 0.6 and PEEP > 5cm H2O

questions.text: Which of the following is a contraindication for Remesivir ?

options.label: B
options.text: Severe renal impairment ( I.e eGFR <30ml/min/m2 or need of hemodialysis)

options.label: C
options.text: History of MI in last one month

questions.text: What should be the serum antibody titres of donor serum for convalescent plasma therapy ?
What are special consideration before using tocilizumab

options.label: A
options.text: Presence of raised inflammatory markes (CRP,ferritin amd IL-6)

options.label: B
options.text: Patients should be carefully monitored for secondary infections and neutropenia

options.label: C
options.text: Active infection and TB should be ruled out before use

questions.text: While giving hydroxychloroquin, what all should be monitored ?

options.label: A
options.text: SpO2 of the patient should be monitored since the drug causes eosinophillic lung disease

options.label: B
options.text: BP monitoring should be done and drug should be stopped if BP < 100/70mmHg

options.label: C
options.text: ECG monitoring should be done to look for QTc prolongation and drug is avoided or should be stopped if QTc > 500ms

options.label: D
options.text: ECG monitoring should be done and HCQ should be voided if QTc > 320ms

questions.correct_answer: C. ECG monitoring should be done to look for QTc prolongation and drug is avoided or should be stopped if QTc > 500ms

questions.text: Persons with suspected contact with corona infection must quarantine for atleast
Following practices are useful for prevention of corona infection Except

A 34 year old male presented to fever clinic with 4 days history of fever, sore throat and cough. There is no past medical history. His wife is positive for covid-19 by RT PCR test done 1 week back. On examination his pulse rate is 105/min, BP-110/70 mmHg, temperature is 100 F, respiratory rate is 16/minute and oxygen saturation by pulse oximeter is 97%. Lungs are clear on auscultation. Rapid antigen test for covid is positive. What will be further management?

options.label: A
options.text: Get HRCT chest, give PCM, steroids and azithromycin

options.label: B
options.text: Home isolation, Symptomatic treatment, monitoring of temperature and oxygen saturation

options.label: C
options.text: Immediate hospital admission to isolate the patient, steroids, and heparin

options.label: D
options.text: Wait till confirmatory RT PCR report for covid

questions.correct_answer: B. Home isolation, Symptomatic treatment, monitoring of temperature and oxygen saturation

questions.text: Mr Sunil Kumar a known case of type 2 diabetes and hypertension on regular medicines presented with history of fever and cough for 1 week and shortness of breath for last 1 day. He got covid vaccine 10 days back. Fever was initially low grade now touching 104 F for last 2 days. His requirement for paracetamol has increased from 2 tablets/day to 4 tablets/day. He is taking vitamin c, zinc, ivermectin and doxycycline after teleconsultation. RT-PCR report for covid is positive. On examination he has pulse rate of 95/min, BP-106/60, respiratory rate of 28/minute. Oxygen saturation is 92% on room air. Lung fields are clear. What will be next step of management

options.label: A
options.text: Admit in ICU, oxygen support, iv antibiotics, get HRCT chest

options.label: B
options.text: Admit in ICU, oxygen support, iv steroids, injection remdesivir

options.label: C
options.text: Admit in ward, oxygen support, iv steroid, heparin

options.label: D
options.text: Admit in ward, oxygen support, injection remdesivir, arrange for plasma therapy

questions.correct_answer: C. Admit in ward, oxygen support, iv steroid, heparin

questions.text: Mr Sunil Kumar(in continuation with question no.2) was admitted in the hospital ward and started on oxygen support, iv methylprednisolone 40 mg twice daily, injection enoxaparin sc 60 mg once daily with supportive treatment. All the following management steps will be correct except

options.label: A
options.text: Oral methylprednisolone can be started if patient improving

options.label: D
options.text: HRCT chest to be done before discharge

questions.correct_answer: D. HRCT chest to be done before discharge

questions.text: For clinical scenario in question 2,patient responded to treatment and fever resolved within 3 days of admission.He is maintaining oxygen saturation above 95%. You are planning to discharge the patient from hospital.Which of the following criteria is NOT true regarding the discharge

options.label: A
options.text: Negative RT PCR test before discharge

questions.correct_answer: A. Negative RT PCR test before discharge

questions.text: A 38 year old female presented to AIIMS emergency with complaints of fever for 12 days. She developed severe cough with shortness of breath for last 2 days. RT-PCR is positive for covid infection .HRCT chest which she got done showed diffuse ground glass opacities involving 70% of lung fields. On examination she is tachypnic, repiratory rate of 30/min with use of accessory muscles of respiration. Pulse rate is 120/min,BP-120/70 mmHg and oxygen saturation 88% on room air.What will be the next line of management for her?

options.label: A
options.text: Get a repeat RT PCR for covid,oxygen support,start favipiravir,keep in emergency observation till report

options.label: B
options.text: Admit in ward,oxygen support,start iv steroids+enoxaparin

options.label: C
options.text: Admit in ICU,oxygen support,start iv steroids+enoxaparin

options.label: D
options.text: Admit in ICU,oxygen support,iv remdesivir+plasma therapy

questions.correct_answer: C. Admit in ICU,oxygen support,start iv steroids+enoxaparin

questions.text: In clincal scenario of question no. 4, patient was started on appropriate treatment. But even after 48 hours her condition is deteriorating with oxygen saturation is falling even with high flow oxygen.Which of the following treatment options can be considered for her

The above mentioned patient gradually improved with treatment in hospital.It is her 10 th day in hospital.You are planning to discharge the patient.Which of the following criteria will be considered for her discharge

A 48 year old male with uncontrolled type 2 diabetes on oral anti diabetes agents presented with history of fever,cough and shortness of breath for last 6 days.His RT PCR test for covid is positive.On examination pulse is 120/min,BP-130/80 mmHg,respiratory rate 32/min,oxygen saturation 86% on room air.Random blood sugar is 300 mg/dl.Blood and urine ketones are negative.He is accepting orally.You admit him in ICU and started covid treatment including iv methylprednisolone,enoxaparin,oxygen support.Which of the following is NOT correct regarding diabetes management

options.label: A
options.text: Insulin infusion should be started immediately

options.label: B
options.text: Start with Basal bolus insulin regimen

options.label: C
options.text: Increase oral anti diabetes agent doses

options.label: D
options.text: Target premeal sugar should be 110-150 mg/dl

questions.correct_answer: A. Insulin infusion should be started immediately

questions.text: A 50 year old female withour any significant medical history presented with severe covid infection and admitted in ICU.She was staretd on iv steroids,low molecular weight heparin and oxygen support non invasive.2 days later her oxygen requirement reduced but blood glucose increased with fasting value of 210 mg/dl and post prandial 280 mg/dl.There is no evidence of sepsis and ketosis.She is accepting orally.What will be appropriate step to control glucose levels

options.label: A
options.text: No medicines to control sugar as it will improve after stopping steroids

questions.text: A 70 year old male developed severe covid infection and was treated in covid dedicated hospital with oxygen,iv dexamethasone,heparin and antibiotics.His fever and inflammatory blood markers normalises but his oxygen saturation remained 90% on room air.He was discharged and advised home oxygen therapy with tapered doses of oral dexamethasone.He returned to OPD after one week complaining of nasal block with brown coloured nasal discharge.He also complaint of facial pain and diplopia.On examination facial swelling on right side is seen with cranial nerve third palsy.Random blood sugar is 270 mg/dl.MRI of paranasal sinus and orbit shows right maxillary sinusitis with orbital extension of inflammation.Which of the following management strategy is NOT suitable for him

options.label: A
options.text: Take biopsy from involved area and wait for microbiological confirmation

options.label: D
options.text: Start Posaconazole even before microbiological confirmation of Mucormycosis

questions.correct_answer: A. Take biopsy from involved area and wait for microbiological confirmation
